text: P . aeruginosa laboratory strains PAO1 and the PAO1deltaexsA mutant were obtained from Dr . Robert Hancock .
P . aeruginosa strains PAO1 and PAO1deltaexsA were grown from overnight cultures in Luria Bertani ( LB ) broth and LB+streptomycin ( 150 microg / ml ) until mid-logarithmic phase .
Cells were washed once in PBS and resuspended in PBS to an optical density of 0.5 ( lambda = 600 nm ) .
To prepare heat-killed bacteria , live PAO1 was resuspended in PBS to an optical density of 0.5 and heated at 60degreesC for 1 hour .
For stimulations , live PAO1 was resuspended to an optical density of 0.5 in PBS and further diluted in culture medium prior to stimulation to achieve the desired multiplicity of infection .
Heat-killed PAO1 was added in a volume equivalent to that used to achieve an MOI of 1 for live PAO1 .
